intro: Zostera polychlamys, commonly known as the broad-leaved eelgrass, is a marine flowering plant found in coastal waters of the North Atlantic. It thrives in shallow, sandy or muddy substrates and forms dense underwater meadows. The plant has long, ribbon-like leaves that are typically 20–40 cm in length. It plays a crucial role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine species. Zostera polychlamys is also important for stabilizing sediments and improving water quality.
